content: Write a country song about the joys and struggles of being a cowboy in the modern world. The lyrics should reflect both nostalgia for simpler times and an appreciation for today's conveniences.

(Title: "Cowboy Code")

(Verse 1)
Way out in the wide-open spaces, where the prairie grass do grow,
There's a cowboy ridein' his horse, singin' a lonesome tune, you know.
He's got his Stetson on his head, his boots are worn and old,
But in his heart, he's got a fire, that never yet has grown cold.

(Chorus)
Oh, the cowboy code, it's a way of life, under the big sky so blue,
From the mesquite to the cottonwoods, I'm a cowboy, me and you.
With the sunset paintin' the horizon, and the stars comin' out to play,
In this modern world, I'm holdin' on, to the cowboy code, night and day.

(Verse 2)
In the old days, it was just him and his horse, against the wild unknown,
Now he's got a smartphone in his pocket, and a GPS to call his own.
He can order groceries online, and pay his bills with a click,
But sometimes he misses the simplicity, of that old-fashioned kick.

(Chorus)
Oh, the cowboy code, it's a way of life, under the big sky so blue,
From the mesquite to the cottonwoods, I'm a cowboy, me and you.
With the sunset paintin' the horizon, and the stars comin' out to play,
In this modern world, I'm holdin' on, to the cowboy code, night and day.

(Bridge)
He's got a John Deere truck, instead of a buckin' bronco,
But when he looks up at the night sky, he feels the same ol' yodelin' yippee-ki-yay.
The world may be changin', and the times they are a-changin' too,
But in his heart, he's still that cowboy, ridin' off into the blue.

(Verse 3)
He's got a drone for herd countin', and a satellite for the weather,
But when he's sittin' by the campfire, he's tellin' stories of the past, y'hear?
Of cattle drives and stampedes, of loves lost and found,
In this modern world, he's holdin' on, to the cowboy code, wearin' it like a crown.

(Chorus)
Oh, the cowboy code, it's a way of life, under the big sky so blue,
From the mesquite to the cottonwoods, I'm a cowboy, me and you.
With the sunset paintin' the horizon, and the stars comin' out to play,
In this modern world, I'm holdin' on, to the cowboy code, night and day.

(Outro)
So here's to the cowboys, both old and new,
To the ones who ride the range, and the ones who do it with a view.
May your hearts stay true, and your spirits stay free,
Under the big sky, you and me, livin' the cowboy code, wild and carefree.

**End of Song**
